page.title: 20LIFEBOAT - WALTON
page.content: The Walton life boat is a 15m Solent with a maximum speed of nine knots. The Walton life boat isn't very old as they got a new boat quite recently. The boat has seven crew members and about five launchers and other helpers. The day to day running of each station is left to the local voluntary committee run by an honoray secretary whose duties include the authorization of each life boat launch. Usually the only full time workman of the station is the mechanic who deals with all the maintenance of the craft. The life boat is moored about fifty metres from the end of the pier. In an emergency the crew members would drive to the life boat station (opposite the pier), get their protective clothing and run down the pier. They go down some steps to a small boat.
